page.title: 19CRICK BUILDINGS
page.content: The oldest building in Crick is the Church. The Chapel was built in 1820. This has a main church with a balcony and 2 Sunday School rooms. The{Village Hall}is used by the people of Crick for parties, pantomimes, shows and various other activities.It has a cloakroom, toilets,kitchen,side rooms, a stage and a large hall. It has recently been decorated with arches into the side rooms. The most common types of homes belonging to our school children are semi-detached houses made of brick with slate or tiled roofs.Not so many live in houses made of stone or bungalows.12 people live in dormer bungalows. 1 person lives in a brick flat with a tarmac roof.
